subject: Re: [junit] Difference running junit in ant compared to Eclipse
msgSnippet: JUnit is explicitly designed for test independence, you can never guarantee test order. Different TestRunner implementations will do different things. ...
messageBody:
JUnit is explicitly designed for test independence, you can never
guarantee test order. Different TestRunner implementations will do
different things.

---
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

Bart Reader wrote:
>
>
> We had differences between running in netbeans , eclips and ant in eclips.
> The order in whitch the tests are run is not fixed and bad written
> tests could run in one order but not in another.
> I guess you should look for manipulation of static fields.
>
> Bart
>
> 2007/3/7, eraonel <eraonel@... <mailto:eraonel%40yahoo.com>>:

> >
> > Any hints!
> >
> > cheers,

> > //mikael
